clues.text: The Rose Bowl
Husky Stadium
Sun Devil Stadium
Tiger Stadium
Boone Pickens Stadium
Do this in public in Singapore & get fined $300--more than you expectorated?
In 17th c. Virginia it cost you 50 pounds of tobacco to miss weekly attendance here
You could be fined if you're caught driving solo in an HOV lane, short for this
6-letter word for one who sprays his own name in graffiti; no matter how cool the signature, he may get fined for it
In 2007 Mass. fined individuals $219 for not having this type of insurance; the 2009 fine was as much as $1,068
"Sally Hemings: A Novel" is a fictional account of this president & his mistress/slave
"Virgin: Prelude to the Throne" imagines her during her teenage years
Peter Green's "The Laughter of Aphrodite" tells about the life & times of this ancient poetess
"Cosette", part 2 of this classic novel, begins with a chapter titled "Waterloo"
Comparable to "Gone with the Wind", M.M. Kaye's "The Far Pavilions" is mainly set in what's now this country
"Vertical" term for a comedian who performs alone on a stage
To funnyman Dick Martin, Dan Rowan was this type of partner providing the setup lines
One book says an impersonator imitates, while this similar performer reveals
It's the British word for a street performer who sings & passes the hat in public
Jeff Dunham, this type of performer, became a YouTube sensation with characters like Peanut & Bubba J.
A 1997 film about guys who take it all off popularized this phrase, its title
This 5-letter synonym for bare or plain is often found before "naked" to mean totally nude
If you went swimming "in the" this word, it doesn't mean in undyed leather, as it might imply
Those naughty French gave us dishabille, meaning only partly clothed, & "au" this, meaning unclothed
A naked person is undressed; a naked statue is this, starting with the same 4 letters as "undressed"

rounds.comments: (Alex: We want you to name the speaker of each clue I deliver.)

clues.text: Kids, I was in theology school in 1952 when I asked Mary Powell to set me up with a friend, who turned out to be Coretta Scott
Well, Irene, it was in the spring of 1894 that a mutual friend introduced me to the radiant Marie Sklodowska
Pen, my boy, I fell in love with your mother's poetry before I met her in person at her Wimpole Street house in May 1845
By Jove, kids, it was around 41 B.C. when your mother sailed up the Cydnus in a barge, dressed as Venus
We'd met as kids since we're distant cousins, but it was 1903 when she became "First Lady" of my heart
Between 1840 & 1902 all British postage stamps had a picture of her
In 1847 Ben Franklin was on the front of one of the first U.S. stamps to have this on the back
A 2002 stamp of this early 20th century performer featured chains that could only be seen with a special lens
In 2007 Portugal issued a stamp made of this stopper material, 1/100 of an inch thick
Whoops!  The 2010 Forever stamp featuring the Statue of Liberty is actually from a photo of the replica in this city
This 9-letter word for a procession of cars is often used to refer to that of the U.S. president
It's the trademark name for the device used by police to measure a driver's alcohol intake
It's the code of online social behavior
It's the smallest element of an image on a computer monitor
This word refers to the visible path in the wake of an aircraft
"Enormous Anticipations"
"Some Story Regarding Multiple Metropolises"
"Holiday Song"
"An Ancient Odds & Ends Boutique"
"Tough Days"
Vodka, triple sec & lime juice go into this drink named for a suicide pilot
In a play on a book title, it's the liquor that precedes mockingbird in the name of a cocktail
To make a brantini, stir together brandy, gin & a dash of the dry type of this
For a greyhound, combine 1 1/2 ounces of gin with 5 ounces of this
A 7 & 7 cocktail gets its name from these 2 ingredients
With LeBron in 2009-10, this team went 61-21; without LBJ the following season, 19-63
For signing Gail Goodrich, the Jazz ended up conveying the very first pick of the 1979 draft to this team, who got Magic Johnson
In every year but 1 between 1959 & '69, the rest of the NBA was green with envy because this was your NBA championship team
The website of this team that joined the NBA in 1966 has a section titled "the team that Mike built"
Named when "Jurassic Park" was big, it's the only NBA team not based in the United States
This Indian wrote, "I have nothing new to teach the world; truth and nonviolence are as old as the hills"
This British scientist born in 1642 said he was only a boy finding pretty shells beside "the great ocean of truth"
Salvatore Giunta, the first living recipient of this medal for actions in Afghanistan, calls himself a mediocre soldier
The 21st century English version of mass includes "Lord, I am not" this "that you should enter under my roof"
In 2011 this politician said he didn't deserve the honor of having the Wilmington, Del. train station named after him

rounds.text: In her memoirs Queen Liliuokalani tells us that before Hawaii had its own national anthem, it used this one
